newsitem.title: USA: NHL-BUFFALO'S ALEXEI ZHITNIK SUSPENDED TWO GAMES.
newsitem.headline: NHL-BUFFALO'S ALEXEI ZHITNIK SUSPENDED TWO GAMES.

text.p: Buffalo Sabres defenceman Alexei Zhitnik was suspended two games by the National Hockey League on Friday for a high-sticking incident during Wednesday night's 2-0 loss at Dallas.

Zhitnik, who will sit out Friday night's game against St Louis and Saturday's contest with Colorado, was also fined $1,000, which is the maximum fine allowed under the Collective Bargaining Agreement.
The incident against Dallas Stars centre Jamie Langenbrunner occurred at 13:30 of the third period and resulted in a match penalty for the Russian defenceman.

"Mr Zhitnik retaliated against a check after the whistle by slashing Mr Langenbrunner on the shoulder and side of the head," said NHL discipline chief Brian Burke in making his ruling. "This type of conduct will not be tolerated."
Zhitnik has a goal and five assists with 21 penalty minutes in 11 games this season.
